Test: is_nilpot

Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan

2021-01-27

Source: vignettes/tests/test_is_nilpot.Rmd
test_is_nilpot.Rmd
library(testthat)
library(matrixR)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'matrixR'
#> The following object is masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     cov2cor
context("Test is_nilpot.")

Parameters

matrix_T_1 <- matrix(
  data = c(
    0, 0,
    1, 0
  ),
  ncol = 2
)
matrix_T_2 <- matrix(
  data = c(
    0, 0, 0, 0,
    2, 0, 0, 0,
    1, 1, 0, 0,
    6, 2, 3, 0
  ),
  ncol = 4
)
matrix_T_3 <- matrix(
  data = c(
    5, 15, 10,
    -3, -9, -6,
    2, 6, 4
  ),
  ncol = 3
)
matrix_T_4 <- matrix(
  data = c(
    5, 6, -11,
    5, 6, -11,
    5, 6, -11
  ),
  ncol = 3
)
matrix_T_5 <- matrix(
  data = c(
    2, 4, -1, -2
  ),
  ncol = 2
)
matrix_F <- matrix(
  data = c(1, 0, 0, 0),
  ncol = 2
)
colnames(matrix_T_1) <- paste0("col", 1:ncol(matrix_T_1))
rownames(matrix_T_1) <- paste0("row", 1:nrow(matrix_T_1))
colnames(matrix_T_2) <- paste0("col", 1:ncol(matrix_T_2))
rownames(matrix_T_2) <- paste0("row", 1:nrow(matrix_T_2))
colnames(matrix_T_3) <- paste0("col", 1:ncol(matrix_T_3))
rownames(matrix_T_3) <- paste0("row", 1:nrow(matrix_T_3))
colnames(matrix_T_4) <- paste0("col", 1:ncol(matrix_T_4))
rownames(matrix_T_4) <- paste0("row", 1:nrow(matrix_T_4))
colnames(matrix_T_5) <- paste0("col", 1:ncol(matrix_T_5))
rownames(matrix_T_5) <- paste0("row", 1:nrow(matrix_T_5))
colnames(matrix_F) <- paste0("col", 1:ncol(matrix_F))
rownames(matrix_F) <- paste0("row", 1:nrow(matrix_F))
knitr::kable(
  x = matrix_F,
  row.names = TRUE,
  caption = "Non-Nilpotent Matrix"
)
Non-Nilpotent Matrix
col1 col2
row1 1 0
row2 0 0 
knitr::kable(
  x = matrix_T_1,
  row.names = TRUE,
  caption = "Nilpotent Matrix"
)
Nilpotent Matrix
col1 col2
row1 0 1
row2 0 0 
knitr::kable(
  x = matrix_T_2,
  row.names = TRUE,
  caption = "Nilpotent Matrix"
)
Nilpotent Matrix
col1 col2 col3 col4
row1 0 2 1 6
row2 0 0 1 2
row3 0 0 0 3
row4 0 0 0 0 
knitr::kable(
  x = matrix_T_3,
  row.names = TRUE,
  caption = "Nilpotent Matrix"
)
Nilpotent Matrix
col1 col2 col3
row1 5 -3 2
row2 15 -9 6
row3 10 -6 4 
knitr::kable(
  x = matrix_T_4,
  row.names = TRUE,
  caption = "Nilpotent Matrix"
)
Nilpotent Matrix
col1 col2 col3
row1 5 5 5
row2 6 6 6
row3 -11 -11 -11 
knitr::kable(
  x = matrix_T_5,
  row.names = TRUE,
  caption = "Nilpotent Matrix"
)
Nilpotent Matrix
col1 col2
row1 2 -1
row2 4 -2

Results

knitr::kable(
  x = data.frame(
    Item = c(
      "Non-Nilpotent Matrix",
      "Nilpotent Matrix",
      "Nilpotent Matrix",
      "Nilpotent Matrix",
      "Nilpotent Matrix",
      "Nilpotent Matrix"
    ),
    Parameter = c(
      "FALSE",
      "TRUE",
      "TRUE",
      "TRUE",
      "TRUE",
      "TRUE"
    ),
    Results = c(
      is_nilpot(matrix_F),
      is_nilpot(matrix_T_1),
      is_nilpot(matrix_T_2),
      is_nilpot(matrix_T_3, tol = 1e-6),
      is_nilpot(matrix_T_4, tol = 1e-6),
      is_nilpot(matrix_T_5)
    )
  ),
  row.names = FALSE
)
Item Parameter Results
Non-Nilpotent Matrix FALSE FALSE
Nilpotent Matrix TRUE TRUE
Nilpotent Matrix TRUE TRUE
Nilpotent Matrix TRUE TRUE
Nilpotent Matrix TRUE TRUE
Nilpotent Matrix TRUE TRUE

testthat

test_that("is_nilpot is TRUE", {
  expect_true(
    is_nilpot(matrix_T_1)
  )
  expect_true(
    is_nilpot(matrix_T_2)
  )
  expect_true(
    is_nilpot(matrix_T_3, tol = 1e-6)
  )
  expect_true(
    is_nilpot(matrix_T_4, tol = 1e-6)
  )
  expect_true(
    is_nilpot(matrix_T_5)
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸŽŠ
test_that("is_nilpot is FALSE", {
  expect_false(
    is_nilpot(matrix_F)
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸŽ‰
